HTableControl

HTable is a control unit intended to display and organize record-oriented data in the table form.  The HTable component allows the user to edit values (table fields), resize and rearrange columns.

Summary
HTableControl
HTable is a control unit intended to display and organize record-oriented data in the table form.
Instance variables
constructor
Constructs a new HTableControl and initializes subcomponents.
_calculateDimensions
Calculates new dimensions whenever columns are added, or data is changed.
addColumn
Adds a column as the last column of the receiver.
setData
Sets the receiver’s data source to a given object.
reloadData
Reload the data for visible views and draw the new values.
removeColumn
Removes a given column from the receiver.
moveColumn
Moves the column and heading at a given index to a new given index.

Instance variables

type’[HTableControl]’
tableColumnsAn array containing the the HTableColumn objects in the receiver.
tableHeaderColumnsAn array containing the the HTableHeaderColumn objects in the receiver.  Extends: HControl

See Also

HTableColumn HTableHeaderView HTableHeaderColumn

constructor

constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)

Constructs a new HTableControl and initializes subcomponents.

Parameters

_rectThe rectangle of the component.  See HView.constructor.  The width of the _rect defines the width of the table column.
_parentClassThe parent component of the component.  See HView.constructor.
_options(Object, optional)

_options attributes

rowHeightThe height of each row in the receiver.
headerViewHeightThe height of of the table header view.
bufferLengthDefines how many views to buffer.
resizeWThe resize portion from the right side of the table header column
resizeEThe resize portion from the left side of the table header column

_calculateDimensions

_calculateDimensions: function()

Calculates new dimensions whenever columns are added, or data is changed.  Makes scrolling very efficient, because you down’t then calculate any dimensions at that time.

addColumn

addColumn: function(_index,
_width,
_name,
_dataView,
_headerView)

Adds a column as the last column of the receiver.

Parameters

_indexThe index identifier of the data column
_widthThe width of the table header column
_nameThe name of the table header column
_dataViewThe data type of the table column
_headerViewThe data type of the table header column

setData

setData: function(_data)

Sets the receiver’s data source to a given object.

Parameters

_dataThe data source for the receiver.  The Data source is a two dimensional array.

reloadData

reloadData: function(_data)

Reload the data for visible views and draw the new values.

removeColumn

removeColumn: function(_column)

Removes a given column from the receiver.

Parameters

_columnThe column to remove from the receiver.

moveColumn

moveColumn: function(_columnIndex,
_newIndex)

Moves the column and heading at a given index to a new given index.

Parameters

_columnIndexThe current index of the column to move.
_newIndexThe new index for the moved column.

_newIndex)
Moves the column and heading at a given index to a new given index.
Abstract foundation class for all active visual components that implement events and values.
An HTableColumn stores the display characteristics and index identifier for a column and determines the width of its column in the HTableControl.
An HTableHeaderView is used by an HTableControl to draw headers over its columns.
An HTableHeaderColumn is used by an HTableHeaderView to draw its column headers.
constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass)
Constructs the logic part of a HView.
